common_issues.title: PiecesOS Desktop App Connectivity and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS Desktop app, including failure to launch, cloud service connection problems, and account linking errors. Troubleshooting steps include verifying network connectivity, checking firewall settings, examining log files, and reinstalling the app. The Pieces team is actively investigating these issues and providing support to affected users.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of Conversation:

**Johnkennyuk** encountered an issue with account linking on Pieces app. They initiated a conversation with **pieces-support-bot** and **mark-at-pieces** provided assistance. 

**Key Points Raised:**

* Johnkennyuk encountered an issue where they were unable to link their Github and Google accounts.
* The current account linking flow is known to be problematic and is planned to be replaced in mid-to-late February.
* Johnkennyuk prefers to keep their custom domain on their Google account as the main account.
* A minor inconsistency in email capitalization was identified as a potential cause of the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* The existing account linking flow is not straightforward and is known to be problematic.
* A minor inconsistency in email capitalization was identified.
* The Github account sign-in process might not be prompting the account linking flow as intended.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces proposed a manual merging of the accounts and offered to walk Johnkennyuk through the process.
* They reset Johnkennyuk's Github account multiple times to troubleshoot the issue.
* They suggested temporarily disabling the email privacy setting on the Github side.
* Johnkennyuk suggested waiting for the new account linking system to be implemented.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The account linking issue remains unresolved.
* Johnkennyuk is waiting for the new account linking system to be released and plans to retry the linking process then.

**Additional Notes:**

* The new account linking system is expected to be ready by the end of February.
* It is unclear whether the email capitalization issue was the actual cause of the problem.
* Johnkennyuk has expressed interest in being among the first users to test the new system.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohanrathi99 is experiencing issues with PiecesOS and PDF:
    * Inability to make requests to cloud services
    * Issues with local models
* This suggests a potential firewall or network configuration problem
* Rohanrathi99 shared log files for debugging

**Problems Identified:**

* Potential firewall or network configuration blocking requests
* Root cause of the issue is still unidentified

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested access to log files
* Scheduled a call for further investigation and root cause identification

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Rohanrathi99 provided log files
* Meeting scheduled for February 24 to investigate the issue further

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation appears ongoing as of February 23.
* The specific solution and ultimate outcome are yet to be determined.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* **User:** MR-AAYU reported issue with booting up the Pieces Desktop application.
* **Support team:**
    * Triaged issue and directed user to related resources.
    * Requested logs for troubleshooting.
    * Analyzed logs to investigate the problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces Desktop application failed to launch.
* Issue likely due to an underlying problem.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support team requested further information (logs) from the user.
* Analysis of logs will provide detailed insight into the problem and possible solutions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue actively investigated.
* Resolution and updates are expected.

**Additional Notes:**

* User has been responsive and shared requested information.
* Support team has exhibited a comprehensive approach to troubleshooting.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS: Network & Dependency Conflicts
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS struggling to connect to cloud services and local LLMs, suggesting network configuration or dependency conflicts. Proposed solutions include verifying network connectivity, reinstalling conflicting software, checking firewall settings, and managing startup order for dependent services like Ollama.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User johnkennyuk encountered Cuda errors when running Ollama server within Pieces OS.
* The errors were related to missing or conflicting Cuda DLLs.
* Reinstalling Ollama and Pieces OS resolved the issue initially, but it reoccurred.
* The problem seemed related to the startup order of Ollama and Pieces OS.
* Disabling Pieces OS automatic launch on startup worked as a workaround.

**Problems Identified:**

* Conflicting Cuda DLL installations between Ollama and Pieces OS.
* Startup order issue causing Ollama to fail to launch within Pieces OS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Reinstalling Ollama and Pieces OS.
* Checking and cleaning the PATH environment variable.
* Disabling Pieces OS automatic launch on startup.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is resolved for now, but the cause remains unclear.
* User requests further investigation into preventing Pieces OS from launching its own Ollama instance if an external one is already running.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue appears to be specific to the user's setup and may not be widespread.
* Further investigation is needed to determine the root cause and a more permanent solution.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS Desktop App Connectivity and Launch Issues:** This appears to be the most common problem, impacting user experience and potentially hindering adoption.

**Investigate and address Pieces OS Network & Dependency Conflicts:** These issues point to potential compatibility problems with other software or network configurations, requiring in-depth troubleshooting and clear guidance for users.
**Improve account linking process:** Ticket #610 highlights long-standing issues with account linking, suggesting a need for a more robust and user-friendly solution.

**Review and update documentation for common issues:** Ensure troubleshooting steps for connectivity, dependency conflicts, and account linking are clear, comprehensive, and easily accessible to users.

**Consider developing a system to detect and prevent conflicts with external Ollama installations:** This could prevent issues like the one described in ticket #570 and improve user experience for those running local LLMs.
**Analyze support tickets for trends and patterns:** This can help identify recurring issues, prioritize bug fixes, and improve overall product stability and user satisfaction.
**Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds to users:** This can help manage expectations and reduce support volume for known problems.
**Gather user feedback on the new account linking system once released:** This will help ensure the new system effectively addresses the issues experienced with the previous one.
